questions.question_text: Which of the following objects cannot be imported via the Salesforce.com Import Wizard?

choices.D: User is given a choice in a pop up window
choices.C: Throws an error and don't allow to make Read only field Mandatory from page layout

questions.question_text: A custom field is made Read only from the Field level security and Required from Page layout. The Field will be:

discussion.content:
I needed to be 100% on this so for anyone wondering, I did a double-check of this and I think the quiz is correct. 

Question 1 - Answer A. User has Read-Only access. Here's why...
I set it as Required via the Page Layout, not during field creation.
Create a text field on Contacts, do not check Required in the field create wizard.
Choose Read Only during field creation.
Add field to Layout and a few Profiles (one should be non-Admin Profile to test with because Admins see Read-Only as Editable.)
On your chosen Page Layout (mine was Contacts)
Edit Page Layout. Find field. Hover over it and click Spanner.
Within Page Layout check the box for "Required".
Save Layout. 
Log in as another non-Admin user, who has Read and Edit access to the object.
Can see, but not Edit the newly required field.
Can save the record without issue.
So "Required" on Page Layout does NOT override "Read Only" at field creation.
user license is not part of the profile also. User license is assigned at user level.

comments.content: You can see what the user license is from the profile page, as well as the other items listed. Role is the only thing you can't see or change. (That's my guess)

questions.question_text: Which of the following is not part of the Profile?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
True
=> https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.fields_about_dependent_fields.htm&type=5
A dependent picklist is a custom or multi-select picklist for which the valid values depend on the value of another field, called the controlling field. Controlling fields can be any picklist (with at least one and fewer than 300 values) or checkbox field on the same record.

Yes - "Controlling fields can be any picklist (with at least one and fewer than 300 values) or checkbox field on the same record". 
https://help.salesforce.com/articleView?id=fields_about_dependent_fields.htm&type=5
